head.title: DDS
head.keywords: DDS, Anar Manafov, Andrey Lebedev, Dynamic Deployment System

section.title: What is DDS?
section.para: The Dynamic Deployment System (DDS) - is a tool-set that automates and significantly simplifies a deployment of user defined processes and their dependencies on any resource management system using a given topology.

listitem.para: implements a single-responsibility-principle command line tool-set and APIs,
treats users’ tasks as black boxes
doesn’t depend on RMS (provides deployment via SSH, when no RMS is present),
supports workers behind FireWalls (outgoing connection from WNs required),
deploys private facilities on demand with isolated sandboxes,
provides a key-value properties propagation service for tasks,
provides a rules based execution of tasks.
